result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan J Cebrero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  Anger management and domestic abuse counseling.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant may apply for expungment if law abiding & fine paid in full within 12 mos.. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan J Cebrero

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan J Cebrero in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states recs.  Court adjourns to the end of the calendar as it's a felony plea.  Back on the record, Atty Martinez proceeds w/arraignment as that hasn't been completed yet.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties in information.  Atty Martinez enters NC plea to Ct 1.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  DE advised of voting rights, felony firearm warnings and appeal rights.

Ct 1:  NC
Probation for 2 years
Conditions of probation:
$618.00 costs/surcharges to be paid per agent during term of probation
DNA sample to be provided
AODA/Treatment
Anger management/domestic abuse counseling
DE may apply for expungement after two years if fines paid in full and no new law violations
Must apply for expungement no later than one year after completion of probation
Any cash bond to be applied

Defendant Juan J Cebrero in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises of waiver today.  Request bind over.  State to file information.  Attorney Martinez agrees and request new ARGN date.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 21, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Juan J Cebrero in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Martinez requests prelim.  Time limits cont'd waived.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 21, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Return date on November 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Juan J Cebrero in court with attorney Cole Ruby o/b/o Andrew I. Martinez.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Need discovery yet.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per jail and DA's office name needs to be amended to Cabrero.

Pre-trial conference on October 3, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Return date on October 14, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Juan J Cebrera appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Stan Woodard.  Prosecuting Atty Michael X. Albrecht appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE has not applied for PD representaiton yet.  $1000.00 Cash bond requested.   Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/K.R.; Absolute Sobriety  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 10:45 am.  Return date scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
